PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask. where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our Province.

Name (MRS H.) F. MANOE LARDEN
Address R.A.X., C. KING, AIR, SASK.
Birthplace NEAR BARRE, ONT.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1910
Where did you set up housekeeping? Homestead
Where had you been living before that? In Victoria
For how many people did you prepare meals? 5
How far was it to your nearest store? 2 mi
How often could a visit be made to the store? Every 3 weeks
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Flour, sugar, tea, coffee, dried apples, prunes

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Ogilvie Royal Household
In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lbs
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2
How much did you use graham flour? Just a little for gems
Whole wheat flour? Not much
Was flour milled locally? No
How far away? 12 mi
What year? 1915
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? about 80¢
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? None
Whole Wheat? None
Farina? A little
Other? None
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes
How did you grind it? With a mill

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

*Breakfast: porridge with sugar, milk or cream, homestead bacon, eggs.*
*Toast with butter & jam, meat all the year—coffee.*
*Dinner: meat, potatoes, vegetables, pudding. Bread, butter, tea, cream.*
*Supper: cold meat or eggs, warmed potatoes or scalloped, fruit cake or gems, bread, butter, tea & cream.*

*My husband & one child & myself—child was seven months old.*

---

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Western Canada? _______1912_______. Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

*Turkey, with the trimmings. Christmas cake.*
*Potatoes.*
*Mr. & Mrs. Henry Gordon & Sons James, Percy, Clarence, baby Steven.*
*Children's ages 6 - 4 - 2 - 2 mos.*
*My husband & I—our baby ½ years had died in Sept.*

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

**Breakfast:** Porridge with sugar, milk or cream. Home-made bacon & eggs. Toast with butter & jam. Meat all the year—loaf.

**Dinner:** Meat, potatoes, vegetables, pudding. Bread, butter, tea, cream.

**Supper:** Cold meat or eggs, warmed potatoes or scalloped—fruit cake or genoa bread, butter, tea & cream.

My husband & one child, myself child was seven months old.
